useReturnRoute.description:
whether to enable return routing on the send presentation message. This value only
has an effect for connectionless exchanges.

useReturnRoute.description:
whether to enable return routing on the send presentation message. This value only
has an effect for connectionless exchanges.

role.description: Our role in the out of band exchange

state.description: State of the out of band invitation

alias.description: Alias for the connection(s) created based on the out of band invitation

reusable.description: Whether the out of band invitation is reusable

autoAcceptConnection.description:
Whether to auto accept the out of band invitation.
If not defined agent config will be used.

mediatorId.description: Mediator used for the out of band exchange

reuseConnectionId.description: The id of the connection that was reused for the out of band exchange

HandshakeProtocol.description:
Enum values should be sorted based on order of preference. Values will be
included in this order when creating out of band invitations.

Pick_JwsGeneralFormat.Exclude_keyofJwsGe.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_JwsGeneralFormat.payload_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

AttachmentData.description: A JSON object that gives access to the actual content of the attachment

base64.description: Base64-encoded data, when representing arbitrary content inline instead of via links. Optional.

json.description: Directly embedded JSON data, when representing content inline instead of via links, and when the content is natively conveyable as JSON. Optional.

links.description: A list of zero or more locations at which the content may be fetched. Optional.

jws.description: A JSON Web Signature over the content of the attachment. Optional.

sha256.description: The hash of the content. Optional.

description.description: An optional human-readable description of the content.

filename.description: A hint about the name that might be used if this attachment is persisted as a file. It is not required, and need not be unique. If this field is present and mime-type is not, the extension on the filename may be used to infer a MIME type.

mimeType.description: Describes the MIME type of the attached content. Optional but recommended.

lastmodTime.description: A hint about when the content in this attachment was last modified.

byteCount.description: Optional, and mostly relevant when content is included by reference instead of by value. Lets the receiver guess how expensive it will be, in time, bandwidth, and storage, to fully fetch the attachment.

attributeName.description: The name that will be used to generate the linked credential

attachment.description: The attachment that needs to be linked to the credential

AnonCredsProposeCredentialFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.createProposal
or CredentialsApi.negotiateOffer

This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.createProposal
or CredentialsApi.negotiateOffer

NOTE: This doesn't include the `issuerId` and `schemaIssuerId` properties that are present in the newer format.

AnonCredsOfferCredentialFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.offerCredential
or CredentialsApi.negotiateProposal

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

AnonCredsAcceptOfferFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.acceptOffer. No options are available for this
method, so it's an empty object

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

Record_string.never_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

AnonCredsAcceptRequestFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.acceptRequest. No options are available for this
method, so it's an empty object

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

DidExchangeState.description: Connection states as defined in RFC 0023.

Record_string.any_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

JsonWebKey.description:
Encapsulates a JSON web key type that includes only the public properties that
can be used in DID documents.

The private properties are intentionally omitted to discourage the use
(and accidental disclosure) of private keys in DID documents.

VerificationMethod.description:
Represents the properties of a Verification Method listed in a DID document.

This data type includes public key representations that are no longer present in the spec but are still used by
several DID methods / resolvers and kept for backward compatibility.

ServiceEndpoint.description: Represents an endpoint of a Service entry in a DID document.

Service.description: Represents a Service entry in a {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#did-document-properties DID document}.

DIDDocumentMetadata.description: Represents metadata about the DID document resulting from a {@link Resolvable.resolve} operation.

privateKeys.description: Private keys to import as part of the did document

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite the existing did document and private keys

AnyJsonObject.description: JSON object that can contain any key-value pairs

Pick_DidCreateBaseOptions.Exclude_keyofD.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Required_AnonCredsResolutionMetadata_.description: Make all properties in T required

Pick_ReturnType_AgentConfig-at-toJSON_.E.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

isInitialized.description: Whether the agent has been initialized.

info.title: @credo-ts/rest
info.description: Rest API for using Credo over HTTP

post.description: create new tenant

get.description: Retrieve proof exchange by proof exchange id

post.description:
Initiate a new presentation exchange as prover by sending a presentation proposal request
to the connection with the specified connection id.

Accept a presentation proposal as verifier by sending an accept proposal message
to the connection associated with the proof record.
Creates a presentation request not bound to any proposal or existing connection
Creates a presentation request bound to existing connection

Accept a presentation request as prover by sending an accept request message
to the connection associated with the proof record.

Accept a presentation as prover by sending an accept presentation message
to the connection associated with the proof record.

get.description: Retrieve all out of band records by query
Retrieve an out of band record by id

delete.description: Deletes an out of band record from the repository.

post.description:
Creates an outbound out-of-band record containing out-of-band invitation message defined in
Aries RFC 0434: Out-of-Band Protocol 1.1.

Creates an outbound out-of-band record in the same way how `createInvitation` method does it,
but it also converts out-of-band invitation message to an "legacy" invitation message defined
in RFC 0160: Connection Protocol and returns it together with out-of-band record.

Creates a new connectionless legacy invitation.

Only works with messages created from:
- /didcomm/credentials/create-offer
- /didcomm/poofs/create-request

Receive an out of band invitation. Supports urls as well as JSON messages. Also supports legacy
connection invitations

Accept a connection invitation as invitee (by sending a connection request message) for the connection with the specified connection id.
This is not needed when auto accepting of connections is enabled.

get.description: Retrieve all credential exchange records by query
Retrieve credential exchange record by credential record id

delete.description: Deletes a credential exchange record in the credential repository.

post.description:
Initiate a new credential exchange as holder by sending a propose credential message
to the connection with a specified connection id.

Accept a credential proposal as issuer by sending an accept proposal message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Initiate a new credential exchange as issuer by creating a credential offer
without specifying a connection id

Initiate a new credential exchange as issuer by sending a offer credential message
to the connection with the specified connection id.

Accept a credential offer as holder by sending an accept offer message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Accept a credential request as issuer by sending an accept request message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

Accept a credential as holder by sending an accept credential message
to the connection associated with the credential exchange record.

get.description: Retrieve connection record by connection id

delete.description: Deletes a connection record from the connection repository.

post.description:
Accept a connection request as inviter by sending a connection response message
for the connection with the specified connection id.

This is not needed when auto accepting of connection is enabled.

Accept a connection response as invitee by sending a trust ping message
for the connection with the specified connection id.

This is not needed when auto accepting of connection is enabled.

get.description: Retrieve basic messages by connection id

post.description: Send a basic message to a connection

get.description: Resolves did and returns did resolution result

post.description:
Import a did (with optional did document).

If no did document is provided, the did will be resolved to fetch the did document.
Create a new did.

400.description: Invalid schemaId or unknown AnonCreds method provided

schemaState.reason: Unknown error occurred while registering schema

post.description: Creates a new AnonCreds schema and registers the schema in the AnonCreds registry

400.description: Invalid credentialDefinitionId or unknown AnonCreds method provided

credentialDefinitionState.reason: Unknown error occurred while registering credentialDefinition

post.description: Creates a new AnonCreds credentialDefinition and registers the credentialDefinition in the AnonCreds registry
